description: Comprehensive dataset of airport codes, including details such as location, type, and geographical coordinates, supporting aviation and travel-related analyses.

metadata.description: Unique identifier for each airport or heliport, typically a code used for reference.
The classification of the airport or landing area, indicating whether it is a heliport, small airport, or other types.
The official name of the airport or heliport.
Height of the airport or heliport above sea level, measured in feet.
Geographical continent where the airport is located; In this dataset, it is primarily 'NA' for North America.
ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code representing the country where the airport is located.
ISO code representing the specific region within the country where the airport is located.
The name of the city or town where the airport is located.
GPS code assigned to the airport; This code is used for navigation and identification purposes.
The International Air Transport Association (IATA) code for the airport; Typically a three-letter code used for ticketing and baggage handling.
Unique local identifier for the airport or heliport, often used for internal reference.
Geographical coordinates of the airport; Represents the longitude and latitude in the format 'longitude, latitude'.
